Subsection.Text: All determinations and court orders regarding the use of secure, nonsecure, or home detention shall be based primarily upon findings that the child:

Paragraph.Text: Presents a substantial risk of not appearing at a subsequent hearing;
Presents a substantial risk of inflicting bodily harm on others as evidenced by recent behavior;
Presents a history of committing a property offense prior to adjudication, disposition, or placement;
Has committed contempt of court by:

SubParagraph.Text: Intentionally disrupting the administration of the court;
Intentionally disobeying a court order; or
Engaging in a punishable act or speech in the court’s presence which shows disrespect for the authority and dignity of the court; or

Paragraph.Text: Requests protection from imminent bodily harm.

Subsection.Text: A child alleged to have committed a delinquent act or violation of law may not be placed into secure, nonsecure, or home detention care for any of the following reasons:

Paragraph.Text: To allow a parent to avoid his or her legal responsibility.
To permit more convenient administrative access to the child.
To facilitate further interrogation or investigation.
Due to a lack of more appropriate facilities.

Subsection.Text: A child alleged to be dependent under chapter 39 may not, under any circumstances, be placed into secure detention care.
The department shall continue to identify alternatives to secure detention care and shall develop such alternatives and annually submit them to the Legislature for authorization and appropriation.

Note.Text: Subsection (1) former s. 39.042(1); s. 985.213(1). Subsections (2), (3) former s. 39.043; s. 985.214. Subsection (4) former s. 39.042(4); s. 985.213(4).
